avalancheActivity.highlights: The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend represent the main danger.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the weekend as well as the scattered wind slabs can be released in some cases in particular on steep shady slopes above the tree line. The avalanches can in some cases reach medium size.
The avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
The avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.

snowpackStructure.comment:
10 to 20 cm of snow, and up to 25 cm in some localities, has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1000 m.
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on soft layers. This applies in particular on shady slopes.
The wind slabs are to be found especially in places that are protected from the wind.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and weakly bonded old snow are to be assessed with care and prudence.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases in particular on very steep shady slopes at intermediate and high altitudes. Caution is to be exercised in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. The wind slabs are covered with new snow and therefore difficult to recognise.
Avalanches can also penetrate deep layers and reach large size in isolated cases.
Maintaining distances between individuals and one-at-a-time descents are recommended.

snowpackStructure.comment:
5 to 15 cm of snow has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1000 m.
Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular on very steep slopes above approximately 2300 m.
avalancheActivity.comment:
Some fresh snow and in particular the wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in particular on steep shady slopes at intermediate and high altitudes. The avalanches can in isolated cases reach medium size.
The wind slabs are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.

Careful route selection and spacing between individuals are recommended.

snowpackStructure.comment:
5 to 10 cm of snow has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1000 m.
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack on shady slopes.
